qas.question: What types of cases are argued in the state courts?

answers.text: involve claims and defenses under state laws

qas.question: How many new cases were filed in 2010?
How many cases did appellate courts receice in 2010?
What types of cases did federal district courts receive in 2010?

answers.text: 282,000 new civil cases, 77,000 new criminal cases, and 1.5 million bankruptcy cases

qas.question: How many new cases were filed in 2012?
There were 20.4 million traffic cases in what year?
How many trial courts received domestic relations cases in 2010?

plausible_answers.text: National Center for State Courts' Court Statistics Project

qas.question: How many civil cases did the federal district courts close in 2010?

context: Most cases are litigated in <a0_0>state courts<a0_0/> and <a1_0>involve claims and defenses under state laws<a1_0/>. In a 2012 report, the <b8_0>National Center for State Courts' Court Statistics Project<b8_0/> found that state trial courts received <a2_0><b5_0>103.5 million<b5_0/><a2_0/> newly filed cases in <b6_0>2010<b6_0/>, which consisted of 56.3 million traffic cases, 20.4 million criminal cases, 19.0 million civil cases, <b7_0>5.9 million<b7_0/> domestic relations cases, and 1.9 million juvenile cases. In 2010, state appellate courts received <a3_0>272,795<a3_0/> new cases. By way of comparison, all federal district courts in 2010 together received only about <a4_0><b9_0>282,000<b9_0/> new civil cases, 77,000 new criminal cases, and 1.5 million bankruptcy cases<a4_0/>, while federal appellate courts received 56,000 new cases.
